subject: Re: [junit] Exporting test Result
msgSnippet: Hi, You best bet is to extend the TestListener class, then use your customized test listener to log the results to the database. Hope that helps, Jeremy ...
messageBody:
Hi,

You best bet is to extend the TestListener class, then use your customized
test listener to log the results to the database.


Hope that helps,

Jeremy


On 3/13/06, marccollin2 <contact@...> wrote:
>
> Hello,
> I think it's a newbie question, but I've no time to convience my
> staffs.
> How can i save testsResults in a file which can be used in a database
> update.
> My question is which class can I extends to write a simple code at the
> end of a test ?
>
> thanks
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
